title: Calories in a Whole Rotisserie Chicken
meta_description: Learn calories in rotisserie chicken whole, with full nutrition facts including protein, fat, sodium, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: Calories in a Whole Rotisserie Chicken
assumptions: Standard supermarket rotisserie chicken (~1.2 kg total weight), roasted with skin, basic seasoning; edible portion (meat + skin) ~800 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, size, cooking method, added oils/sauces, and portion yields. Check labels or packaging when available.

quick_answer.text: A whole rotisserie chicken provides ~1520 kcal and ~200 g protein from edible portions.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in rotisserie chicken whole?
faqs.a: About 1520 kcal for a standard whole rotisserie chicken's edible portions.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a whole rotisserie chicken?
faqs.a: Approximately 200 g of protein from meat and skin.
No carbs, fiber, or sugars in plain rotisserie chicken.

faqs.q: Why is sodium high in rotisserie chicken?
faqs.a: From added salt in seasoning; ~2400 mg total for the whole bird.

faqs.q: How does size affect calories in rotisserie chicken whole?
faqs.a: Larger birds (over 1.5 kg) can add 200-400 kcal; smaller ones less.
